stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on polishing the beach-themed level’s water (waves, foam shaders) and experimented with a new audio system while explaining an obscure sound bug, commenting on emulator issues, and chatting with the team and audience.

development_findings.summary: Paused work on a new feature that would allow two sound effects from the same bank to play simultaneously, intended to raise overall SFX quality.
development_findings.quote: Basically what I'm trying to do is make it so that two sound effects per bank can play at the same time. This would seriously improve the sound effect quality across the board.

development_findings.summary: Identified the cause of the infamous low-pitched "booloof" in Big Boo’s Haunt: the boo groan is baked into the wind sample and only audible when the sound loops are interrupted.
development_findings.quote: What's really going on is that the booloof is just a part of the wind sound effect… when you cancel the sound effect, you do hear it.

development_findings.summary: Implemented shoreline wave-height reduction by repurposing unused bits of the vertex color channel to store per-vertex height data, conserving memory.
development_findings.quote: We could use the lower bits of the red channel for the wave height. I think that might genuinely be our best option.

development_findings.summary: Prototyped dynamic foam: clamped texture + sine-wave scroll; encountered exporter limitations (no material labels) and wrote a workaround to locate display-list commands at runtime.
development_findings.quote: If we don't get material labels, I'm going to make an init function now that finds the index of the thing I need.

development_findings.summary: Engine currently at ~59 MB; major remaining content: final Bowser fight and about five side levels. Recent time spent on engine upgrades rather than new content.
development_findings.quote: We're still missing the final Bowser. We're missing like five side levels… in the meantime I've been upgrading the engine.

development_findings.summary: Confirmed RTYI is tested mainly on Project64 1.6 despite its vulnerability; Parallel emulator considered unreliable after an off-by-one memory bug broke his last demo release.
development_findings.quote: It actually pisses me off so much that on the last RTYI demo release… a Parallel bug caused the emulator to not work for a bunch of people.

context_findings.summary: Kaze keeps a private repository with all assets and gives ~10 trusted people access in case something happens to him.
context_findings.quote: There's like 10 people that have access to Return to Yoshi's Island. I also have a private repo with all the assets, so nothing would be lost if I died.

context_findings.summary: Expresses a utilitarian view of life/value—sees personal worth mainly in his creative output and recounted a recent near-death dog incident.
context_findings.quote: I mean, I myself as a human don't have much value, right? The value's in what I make.

context_findings.summary: Avoids AI tools to prevent community backlash and because he sees little benefit for this project right now.
context_findings.quote: People will get really mad at me if I do anything AI… definitely not enough to justify people being upset at me.

context_findings.summary: States deliberate neutrality on ‘culture-war’ politics to keep streams focused and avoid division.
context_findings.quote: My new excuse for not ever taking a political stance… I will say it's all culture war and I will not be discussing any culture-war issues.

context_findings.summary: Feels pressured by constant release-date questions and finds them distracting.
context_findings.quote: How have so many people been asking me for the release date? What is going on?

biobak.summary: Provided real-time art feedback on wave size and shoreline behavior; Kaze adapted shaders until reaching the look Biobak wanted.
biobak.quote: I think this is exactly what Biobak wanted. We got big waves over there and then small waves here.

biobak.summary: Will eventually re-texture objects Kaze is blocking out; Kaze keeps placeholders ‘so Biobak doesn't puke’.
biobak.quote: I'm not trying to put too much work into this… just get this semi-decent looking so Biobak doesn't puke when he sees this.

zeina.summary: Mostly personal presence; sent Kaze photos during stream.
zeina.quote: Zayna is sending me pictures. Yes. Look what a nice region we were in.

key_stories.title: Doubling the Sound Channels
key_stories.summary: Kaze attempted to let two samples from the same bank play concurrently to improve audio fidelity but hit unexpected complexity mid-stream and shelved it.
key_stories.challenge: N64 audio engine limits one active sample per bank, lowering SFX richness.
key_stories.process: Began coding new mixer logic live; ran into messy edge-cases and abandoned for now.
key_stories.outcome: Feature postponed; flagged as future milestone.
key_stories.key_quote: I don't think I should be working on this right now because this is too complicated, so we're gonna be working on this (water) instead.

key_stories.title: Solving the ‘Booloof’ Mystery
key_stories.summary: Explained and demonstrated why a low-pitched boo noise sometimes plays in Big Boo’s Haunt: it's embedded at the tail of the wind sample and only surfaces when the loop is interrupted.
key_stories.challenge: Community myth attributed it to doorway pitch change.
key_stories.process: Inspected sample bank, loop points, and room-change logic live on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Provided definitive technical explanation; potential future clean-up.
key_stories.key_quote: The truth is actually so much more messed up than that… the booloof is part of the wind sound effect.

key_stories.title: Parallel Emulator Memory Bug
key_stories.summary: Previous demo crashed for many players because Parallel N64 had an off-by-one error that made the last byte of RAM unusable.
key_stories.challenge: RTYI decompresses files to the very end of extended memory; emulator read wrong value.
key_stories.process: Worked with emulator dev Falco to patch it before release but end-users didn’t get update.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze lost faith in Parallel; uses PJ64 for testing and will delay dealing with Parallel until release.
key_stories.key_quote: This wouldn't have been a problem if they didn't test in production.

open_questions.context: Kaze introduced the idea but shelved it mid-stream due to complexity.
questions: What specific technical hurdles stopped progress?
Is the goal still feasible on N64 hardware?
How would richer SFX alter level design or atmosphere?

open_questions.context: Current shader/foam prototype accepted for now but still considered placeholder until Biobak’s re-texture.
questions: What visual references guide the final water aesthetic?
How will Biobak’s textures integrate with the current shader logic?
Any performance concerns on real hardware?

open_questions.context: Lack of material labels forces hacky runtime search; Kaze started writing a workaround.
questions: Will the exporter tool gain proper material labels?
How much time is lost to these workarounds?
Could open-sourcing the tool invite outside fixes?

open_questions.context: Still missing final Bowser fight and ~5 side levels.
questions: What design goals remain for the final Bowser?
How are responsibilities divided for the side levels?
Is there an internal target date or milestone?
How does Kaze manage audience pressure around release dates?

open_questions.context: Private repo with ~10 collaborators in case something happens to Kaze.
questions: Who exactly has access and what are their roles?
Is there a formal plan for finishing/releasing RTYI without Kaze?
Any legal arrangements concerning IP rights?

open_questions.context: Kaze avoids AI to prevent community backlash and sees limited utility.
questions: Has the team evaluated any AI uses that wouldn’t upset fans?
Would AI be acceptable for non-creative tasks (e.g., build scripts)?
How does the controversy influence future tooling decisions?

open_questions.context: Kaze favors PJ64 for testing despite known vulnerability; Parallel remains unstable.
questions: Will RTYI ship with a recommended emulator?
Could the project contribute fixes upstream to ensure stability?
How does emulator variance affect QA and debugging?
